entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: The main antagonist of the story. He is mentioned as having knowledge of the cup and locket.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: A wise and powerful wizard who is in sympathy with Hermione's society. He mentions that Voldemort knew of the existence of the cup and locket.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: The founder of a society that Dumbledore feels more in sympathy with. She set up the society.

entities.name: morfin
entities.description: A person who was accused and convicted by the time Dumbledore traced him.

entities.name: hepzibah
entities.description: The owner of two missing treasures, a cup and a locket. Her family suspected that they were stolen.

entities.name: hokey
entities.description: A person who was convicted by the time Hepzibah's family realized their treasures were missing.

entities.name: borgin and burkes
entities.description: A shop where a young man worked as an assistant.

entities.name: s.p.e.w.
entities.description: Hermione's society that Dumbledore feels more in sympathy with.

entities.name: ministry
entities.description: The governing body of the wizarding world.

relationships.description: Voldemort knew of the existence of the cup and locket.
Dumbledore feels more in sympathy with Hermione's society.
Hepzibah had two missing treasures, a cup and a locket.
Hokey worked as an assistant at Borgin and Burkes.
Hepzibah's family suspected that the cup and locket were stolen.
The Ministry accused and convicted Morfin.
